sentences.english: The Man shut his eyes hard as the tears poured down his face.
sentences.chinese: 男人用力地闭上了眼睛，泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: Here is a number of breathtaking photographs to inspire you!
sentences.chinese: 下面就是一些慑人心魄的照片，能让你灵感有如泉涌。

sentences.english: Andrew was not ashamed to find that tears were coursing down his face.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁泪如泉涌，却并不为之惭愧。

sentences.english: The imagined grief was so poignant that Bertha burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 想象的悲恸是如此强烈，使伯莎泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: Moses believed and obeyed, and water gushed from the stone.
sentences.chinese: 摩西相信且顺服，水因而从石头中泉涌而出。

sentences.english: She sat there alone, with tears streaming down her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她独自坐在哪儿，泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: Already they were sweating as the sun beat down upon them.
sentences.chinese: 太阳火辣辣地晒着他们，他们已是汗如泉涌。

sentences.english: Creativity can get your juices flowing.
sentences.chinese: 创造性可以让你思如泉涌。

sentences.english: Tears well from her eyes whenever she thinks of those days.
sentences.chinese: 她不论什么时候想起那些日子眼泪就泉涌而出。

sentences.english: His father stared in surprise and then burst out in tears.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲惊奇地盯着他，然后便泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: She thanked him and hung up the phone, her tears now flowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 她谢过店主，挂断了电话，泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: This inspiring neighbor of mine often set my mind woking.
sentences.chinese: 这个“邻居”时常给我灵感，让我思如泉涌。

sentences.english: My tears poured when I saw the pictures.
sentences.chinese: 当我看到地震的照片时，我泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: She went home in a flood of tears and a sedan chair.
sentences.chinese: 她泪如泉涌地坐着轿子回家了。

sentences.english: The beautiful scenery inspired the composer.
sentences.chinese: 美丽的景色使作曲家灵思泉涌。

definition: to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to overflow/transverse flow/to flow over/cross flow
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
